# Placeholder

<DarkModeCompatible />

Layout placeholder block for prototyping and spacing. A visual utility component for sketching layouts during development.

## Overview

Use `Placeholder` when you need…

- A quick visual block while prototyping layouts
- Control over `height` and `width`
- A solid `color` or a gradient via `colorFrom` / `colorTo`
- A label via `children`

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Placeholder } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx title="src/App.tsx"
import { Placeholder } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function App() {
  return <Placeholder>Placeholder</Placeholder>;
}
```

## Anatomy

The Placeholder component is a simple visual block for prototyping:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                     │
│           [children]                │  ← Placeholder Container
│         (optional label)            │     (customizable size & color)
│                                     │
└─────────────────────────────────────┘
```

**Component Structure:**

- **Container**: A block element with customizable dimensions and background
- **Children** (optional): Content displayed inside (typically a label for identification)

**Sizing:**

- Width: auto (default), small, medium, large, or full
- Height: small, medium (default), large, auto (content-based), or full

**Coloring:**

- Solid color via `color` prop
- Gradient via `colorFrom` and `colorTo` props

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop        | Type                                                 | Default    | Description                                  |
| ----------- | ---------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | -------------------------------------------- |
| `children`  | `ReactNode`                                          | -          | Content to display inside the placeholder    |
| `color`     | `string`                                             | -          | Solid background color (any valid CSS color) |
| `colorFrom` | `string`                                             | -          | Gradient start color (requires `colorTo`)    |
| `colorTo`   | `string`                                             | -          | Gradient end color (requires `colorFrom`)    |
| `height`    | `'small' \| 'medium' \| 'large' \| 'auto' \| 'full'` | `'medium'` | Height variant of the placeholder            |
| `width`     | `'auto' \| 'small' \| 'medium' \| 'large' \| 'full'` | `'auto'`   | Width variant of the placeholder             |

Also supports standard HTML `div` attributes (e.g., `className`, `style`, `data-*`).

### Height Details

- **small**: 64px fixed height, suitable for compact UI elements
- **medium**: 128px fixed height, default for most prototyping needs
- **large**: 256px fixed height, useful for hero sections or large content blocks
- **auto**: Height adjusts to content, useful for text or variable content
- **full**: 100% height, fills parent container

### Width Details

- **auto**: Width adjusts to content (default, inline-block behavior)
- **small**: 128px fixed width, useful for sidebar elements
- **medium**: 256px fixed width, good for card-like components
- **large**: 512px fixed width, suitable for wide content blocks
- **full**: 100% width, fills parent container

### Color Details

- **color**: Any valid CSS color value (hex, rgb, named colors, or token references)
- **colorFrom / colorTo**: Creates a diagonal gradient (top-left to bottom-right)

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Use `Placeholder` to sketch layout and spacing quickly during development
- Use `height="auto"` when you want the placeholder to grow with its content
- Prefer token colors (`tokens.color.*`) when demonstrating examples

### Don't ❌

- Don’t ship `Placeholder` in production UI unless it’s intentional (it’s meant for prototyping)
- Don’t use placeholders as a replacement for a skeleton/loading state component

## Accessibility

The Placeholder component is designed as a development utility:

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Use Placeholder only during development and prototyping phases
- Replace placeholders with semantic components before production
- If temporarily representing a UI region, document what the final component will be
- Use meaningful labels in children to identify placeholder purpose

#### Don't ❌

- Don't ship Placeholder components in production without semantic alternatives
- Don't use placeholders to represent interactive elements
- Don't rely on color alone to identify placeholder purpose

### Screen Reader Considerations

```tsx
// If temporarily using in production, provide context:
<Placeholder aria-label="Image placeholder - final design pending">Product Image</Placeholder>
```

Since Placeholder is decorative, consider adding `aria-hidden="true"` if the content is purely visual:

```tsx
<Placeholder aria-hidden="true">{/* Decorative content */}</Placeholder>
```

## Common Patterns

### Layout Prototyping

```tsx title="src/components/LayoutPrototype.tsx"
import { Placeholder } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function LayoutPrototype() {
  return (
    <div style={{ display: 'flex', gap: '16px' }}>
      <Placeholder width="small" height="full" color="#e0e0e0">
        Sidebar
      </Placeholder>
      <div style={{ flex: 1 }}>
        <Placeholder height="small" width="full" color="#f0f0f0">
          Header
        </Placeholder>
        <Placeholder height="large" width="full" color="#f5f5f5">
          Main Content
        </Placeholder>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Visual Spacing Reference

```tsx title="src/components/SpacingDemo.tsx"
import { Placeholder } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function SpacingDemo() {
  return (
    <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', gap: '8px' }}>
      <Placeholder height="small" width="medium" color="#ddd">
        Small (64px)
      </Placeholder>
      <Placeholder height="medium" width="medium" color="#ccc">
        Medium (128px)
      </Placeholder>
      <Placeholder height="large" width="medium" color="#bbb">
        Large (256px)
      </Placeholder>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Gradient Backgrounds

```tsx title="src/components/GradientPlaceholder.tsx"
import { Placeholder } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function GradientPlaceholder() {
  return (
    <Placeholder height="large" width="full" colorFrom="#667eea" colorTo="#764ba2">
      Hero Section
    </Placeholder>
  );
}
```

## Related Components

- **Space** - For adding explicit spacing between elements
- **Stack** - For organizing content with consistent gaps
- **Grid** - For creating structured layouts
- **Flex** - For flexible container layouts

## TypeScript Support

The Placeholder component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
interface PlaceholderProps {
  children?: ReactNode;
  color?: string;
  colorFrom?: string;
  colorTo?: string;
  height?: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | 'auto' | 'full';
  width?: 'auto' | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | 'full';
}
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE.
